title: Analyze data to determine conservation of energy

content.question: Object <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> travels across a horizontal surface and collides with object <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The velocity as a function of time for object <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and object <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> before, during, and after the collision is shown in the graph. Both objects have a mass of <math alttext="2 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly describes the momentum <math alttext="vector p" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></math> of the system and the kinetic energy <math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the system?

choices.label: <math alttext="vector p" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></math> <math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> Not conserved Conserved

<math alttext="vector p" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></math><math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>Not conservedNot conserved

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
